title: 'Pak PM would have died if ... ': Donald Trump misspeaks - what he meant
content: US President Donald Trump claimed during his State of the Union address that his intervention prevented a nuclear war between India and Pakistan, stating the Pakistan Prime Minister would have died without his involvement. He cited praise from the Pakistani PM for saving "35 million" lives. However, India has rejected any third-party mediation in de-escalating tensions during Operation Sindoor.

title: 'Welcome, Modi': Jerusalem Post front page features PM as he embarks on 2-day Israel visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi graces the front page of The Jerusalem Post ahead of his historic visit to Israel.  The newspaper highlights the burgeoning India-Israel partnership and Modi's upcoming address to the Knesset, marking a significant milestone.  Discussions will focus on deepening bilateral ties across various sectors, including technology, defense, and economy.

title: T20 WC semi-finals qualification scenario: What India must do to stay alive
content: India face a virtual knockout phase in the T20 World Cup after a significant loss to South Africa, severely impacting their net run rate. They must now win their remaining matches convincingly against Zimbabwe and West Indies, while also hoping for favorable results in other games to secure a semi-final spot.

title: Elon Musk slams Anthropic for accusing Chinese AI models of stealing its data
content: AI giant Anthropic accused Chinese firms of stealing data. Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded, claiming Anthropic itself steals data. He pointed to reports of Anthropic using copyrighted books and online data for training. Musk also called Anthropic's AI models 'misanthropic and evil' due to alleged biases. This exchange highlights ongoing tensions in the AI industry.

title: 'Bad policy, but nice guy': Donald Trump on NYC mayor Zohran Mamdani
content: During his State of the Union address, US President Trump unexpectedly mentioned New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani, calling him a "nice guy" despite ideological differences. Trump used Mamdani as an example to advocate for stricter voter ID laws, contrasting the requirements for a snow-shoveling job with those for voting.

title: Blueprint for revival: How India can reignite their T20 World Cup campaign
content: Following a significant defeat to South Africa, India faces calls for tactical adjustments. Key recommendations include diversifying the left-heavy top order, recalling all-rounder Axar Patel for control, and refining the Powerplay batting approach. Rethinking Hardik Pandya's bowling role and adopting a focused mindset are also crucial for recovery.

title: Sam Altman at IIT-Delhi: 'Traditional career advice wonâ€™t work in the AI era'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman advised young Indians against solely relying on traditional career advice, emphasizing the need to develop and trust their own intuition in the rapidly changing AI era. He acknowledged that while some jobs will disappear, new ones will emerge, urging a balanced perspective on AI's impact and encouraging calculated risk-taking for future success.

title: Fresh details emerge in Jharkhand air crash probe; no Mayday call sent
content: An air ambulance en route from Ranchi to Delhi disappeared from radar shortly after departure, after the pilot requested a lower cruising height amid deteriorating weather conditions. Authorities say there was no distress call before contact was lost.

title: Bhopal man dies after speeding Thar rams car in Goa
content: A 65-year-old tourist from Bhopal died after his car was hit by a speeding SUV at the Happy Bar junction in Assagao. Eyewitnesses allege occupants of the rented SUV attempted to switch seats after the collision. Police are investigating the incident, verifying claims of a driver cover-up.

title: 'Black people aren't apes!' US lawmaker escorted out for protest during Trump's speech
content: During President Trump's State of the Union, Democratic Rep. Al Green was removed from the House chamber for holding a sign stating 'Black people arenâ€™t apes!' This protest referenced a racist video of the Obamas on Trump's social media. Green aimed for Trump to see the message, asserting Black people are not apes.

title: After IBM's worst day on stock market, VP: AI tools emerge, what they donâ€™t change is ...
content: IBM faced its worst stock market day in over 25 years. Fears arose that a new AI tool from Anthropic could challenge its core business. IBM defended its mainframe platform, stating its value transcends specific programming languages like COBOL. The company highlighted its own AI investments for code modernization, emphasizing the complexity of enterprise workloads beyond simple code translation.

title: 'Tariffs will replace income tax': Trump defends trade deals after Supreme Court ruling
content: President Trump asserted that most trading partners wish to maintain existing trade deals despite a Supreme Court ruling invalidating some tariffs. He also suggested tariff revenue could eventually replace income taxes, claiming these duties fueled economic growth and generated billions. However, a New York Fed paper indicated US firms and consumers bore most tariff costs.

title: Emotion, devotees surge at Bhojshala as ASI report fuels demand for temple
content: An Archaeological Survey of India report, submitted to the MP High Court, concludes the Kamal Maula Mosque at Bhojshala was built using parts of ancient temples. Scientific investigations reveal the structure, dating back to the Paramara dynasty, incorporates dismantled temple remains. The court has directed parties to file objections on the findings.

title: 16-year-old girl holds fatherâ€™s legs as elder sister slits his throat in UP
content: Two sisters in Muzaffarnagar allegedly murdered their father after enduring years of discrimination and taunts. The daughters, aged 16 and 32, drugged their family before the elder sister slit their sleeping father's throat. Police detained the sisters, who confessed to the crime, citing his differential treatment and constant criticism.

title: Talk on Kashmir incident sparks protest at Azim Premji University in Bengaluru
content: Tension erupted at Azim Premji University as ABVP activists protested a scheduled discussion on alleged state violence in Kashmir. Police took around 25 activists into custody. The university clarified no event was authorized or held on campus, condemning the disruption. AISA accused ABVP of stifling academic debate.

title: 'Will consolidate ties': PM Modi leaves for Israel â€” Whatâ€™s on agenda
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Israel aims to further consolidate the strong bond and strategic partnership between the two nations. Discussions with Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu will focus on strengthening cooperation across various domains, including defense, trade, technology, and economic ties, while also addressing regional developments.

title: Turnaround time: India eye reboot vs Zimbabwe after heavy loss to South Africa
content: Following a significant loss to South Africa, Team India faces Zimbabwe in a must-win match at Chepauk, needing a strong performance to boost morale and improve their net run rate. With key batters struggling, India hope for a dominant win while acknowledging external factors and Zimbabwe's inexperience in Indian conditions.

title: 'Drill, baby, drill': Trump hails US oil boost, calls Venezuela 'new friend and partner'
content: President Trump touted record-high American natural gas and oil production, attributing it to his "drill, baby, drill" policy. He also highlighted a significant oil import from Venezuela, calling the nation a "friend and partner."  Despite claims of falling gas prices, AAA data indicated higher averages than stated.

title: â€˜Doomsday presidentâ€™: Who is Donald Trump's 'designated survivor' Mike Thompson?
content: During President Trump's State of the Union, Congressman Mike Thompson served as the designated survivor, a security measure ensuring government continuity. This role, though less dramatic than fiction suggests, requires constitutional eligibility and focuses the mind on potential catastrophic events. The practice, originating during the Cold War, ensures a successor is available if disaster strikes.

title: Candace Owens sparks backlash with investigative series on Erika Kirk
content: Candace Owens has stirred major controversy after releasing the trailer for her YouTube investigative series The Bride of Charlie, centered on Erika Kirk. The preview quickly went viral, prompting backlash, intense online debate, and questions directed at Charlie Kirkâ€™s allies. While supporters call it accountability journalism, critics warn it risks harassment and speculation, as silence from prominent conservative voices fuels growing tension.

title: NBA trade rumor: Lakers eye $131M Cavaliers superstar in major deal
content: Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly eyeing Cleveland Cavaliers' Jarrett Allen before the 2026 trade deadline. The proposed deal involves sending Austin Reaves and future draft picks to Cleveland. This move aims to bolster the Lakers' frontcourt with much-needed size and defense, while the Cavaliers could gain scoring and guard play.

title: MLB trade rumor: Tigers target $340M Padres superstar as Cabrera successor
content: Detroit Tigers are reportedly considering a major trade for San Diego Padres star Fernando Tatis Jr. This move aims to significantly strengthen their batting for the 2026 season. The Tigers would send several promising young players to San Diego in exchange for Tatis. This potential deal signals a shift for Detroit from rebuilding to actively competing.

title: Priyanka Gandhi urges PM Modi to highlight Gaza plight during Israel visit
content: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address the Gaza crisis during his Israel visit and speak for justice for civilians. This call comes as PM Modi embarks on a state visit to Israel. The Congress party has also criticized the government's stance on the conflict, accusing it of abandoning the Palestinian cause.

title: Mistaken identity? Gurudwara cook who was kidnapped & killed was not intended target
content: A Sikh temple volunteer, Avtaar Singh, was abducted and found dead in California, authorities confirmed. Officials stated Singh was not the intended target of the kidnapping, which occurred after another individual for a specific, undisclosed reason. His body was discovered nearly 100 miles from the temple where he was last seen.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,500; BSE Sensex up over 400 points
content: Stock market today: After a day of steep fall, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex opened in green on Wednesday on positive to mixed global cues. While Nifty50 went above 25,500, BSE Sensex was up over 400 points

title: T20 World Cup: India XI vs Zimbabwe - stay patient or ring in the changes?
content: Team Indian honed their skills in Chennai ahead of their crucial Zimbabwe clash, with batting combinations dominating discussions for the T20 World Cup Super Eight contest. Rinku Singh was the notable absentee from the session, leaving the camp due to a family emergency.

title: After rape threats and body-shaming, influencer deletes viral Miller reel
content: A video of influencer RJ Princy Parikh with David Miller went viral after Indiaâ€™s loss, but she claimed she received rape threats and body-shaming abuse, prompting her to delete it from Facebook and plan a police complaint. On the field, South Africa beat India by 76 runs, bowling them out for 111. David Miller starred with 63, while Jansen and Maharaj led the bowling.

title: Trump tariff refunds may reach companies but what about consumers?
content: The US Supreme Court has ordered the refund of $134 billion in tariffs collected under Trump's administration. However, consumers, who indirectly bore the cost through higher prices, are unlikely to receive any of these refunds. Instead, the reimbursements will go to importers who initially paid the levies.

title: T20 World Cup: A year older, Harry Brook's wise 'night out' at Pallekele
content: In the past three days, Harry Brook has not only grown a year older but also wiser. His century against Pakistan in Kandy was not just a match-winning knock, but a defining leadership moment, signalling Englandâ€™s faith in a captain who is learning, maturing, and delivering when it matters most.

title: Watch: Turkish Air Force F-16 crashes during mission flight, pilot killed
content: A Turkish Air Force F-16 fighter jet tragically crashed during a mission flight in BalÄ±kesir early Wednesday, resulting in the pilot's death. The aircraft, from the 9th Main Jet Base Command, lost radio and radar contact shortly after takeoff. Authorities have launched an investigation into the cause of the crash, with officials offering condolences to the pilot's family.

title: Trade, defence & security on agenda as PM Modi heads to Israel
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's two-day visit to Israel, commencing Wednesday, aims to strengthen the strategic partnership and address shared challenges. The agenda includes meetings with Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu, an address to the Knesset, and discussions on technology, defense, and trade. An upgraded security pact and a potential free trade agreement are key outcomes anticipated from this significant diplomatic engagement.

content: Stock market recommendations: Tata Chemicals, Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation, and Colgate-Palmolive are the top stock recommendations by Mehul Kothari, DVP - Technical Research, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers. title: After Amma: AIADMK's struggle to fill the void left by Jayalalithaa
content: Nearly a decade after J Jayalalithaa's death, the AIADMK struggles to regain its dominance, battling leadership disputes and electoral defeats. As Tamil Nadu heads to the 2026 assembly polls, the party, now led by Edappadi Palaniswami, seeks to overcome the void left by 'Amma' and forge alliances to challenge the ruling DMK.

title: Toilet trouble: US troops feel the 'pressure' as Trump vows to flush out Khamenei regime
content: America's most advanced aircraft carrier, the USS Gerald R Ford, is grappling with persistent sewage system failures during its extended deployment near the Middle East. Despite the Navy's assurances of operational readiness, the $13 billion vessel's next-generation plumbing struggles with waste from its 4,600-strong crew, leading to frequent clogs and demanding 19-hour shifts for engineers.

title: US moves closer to tougher H-1B wage norms after proposal clears federal review
content: United States is nearing changes to foreign worker wage rules. A proposed regulation impacting H-1B visas and green cards has cleared federal review. This could increase minimum wage requirements for sponsored workers. Indian professionals, who form a large part of H-1B visa holders, will be significantly affected. The revised framework may apply to the 2027 H-1B season.

title: Why Jake Guentzel turned down Trumpâ€™s State of the Union invitation
content: Jake Guentzel, fresh off helping Team USA win Olympic gold, did not attend the White House visit or State of the Union. Instead, he stayed in Florida to prepare for the Tampa Bay Lightningâ€™s NHL return. While President Donald Trump honored the team in Washington, Guentzelâ€™s absence reflected his focus on the ongoing season and his commitment to his teamâ€™s Stanley Cup pursuit.

title: â€˜Tea is not optionalâ€™: What living in India taught a Zambian engineering student
content: A Zambian student in India navigates cultural nuances with humor and keen observation, sharing her experiences on Instagram. From decoding the iconic head wobble to embracing the ubiquity of tea and mastering auto rickshaw rides, her journey highlights the subtle yet significant adaptations of living abroad.

title: After Rs 50L reward from Bihar CM, Sooryavanshi gets new Rs 22 lakh car
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi continues to shine after a stunning IPL 2025 and U-19 World Cup 2026. He received a Tata Curvv car for winning the CURVV Super Striker award and Rs 50 lakh from Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, while BCCI announced â‚¹7.50 crore for the U-19 team. Vaibhav scored 175 in the World Cup final and a 35-ball IPL century, becoming the youngest debutant and centurion.

title: Source: Kyler hasn't talked to Cards, refuting GM
content: Cardinals general manager Monti Ossenfort said he has spoken with quarterback Kyler Murray, but a source told ESPN that the two have not talked since the end of the season.

title: Boozer goes off as Duke beats Notre Dame by 44
content: Cameron Boozer had 24 points and 13 rebounds as No. 1 Duke beat Notre Dame 100-56 on Tuesday night, handing the Irish their worst home loss since 1898.

title: Sources: Aubrey pushes for bigger Cowboys offer
content: The Cowboys have extended an offer to Brandon Aubrey that would make him the highest-paid kicker in the NFL, sources told ESPN, but Aubrey's agent has asked for a deal closer to $10 million per season.

title: Hellebuyck set for Medal of Freedom, Trump says
content: Connor Hellebuyck, the goaltender for the gold-medal-winning U.S. men's Olympic hockey team, will be awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom, President Donald Trump announced during Tuesday night's State of the Union.

title: Lynch believes 49ers, Williams 'on the same page'
content: Shortly after ESPN's Adam Schefter reported Tuesday that left tackle Trent Williams and the 49ers are "struggling to find a contractual solution," general manager John Lynch offered a more optimistic perspective.

title: Carlisle questions NBA's process for Pacers' fine
content: Pacers coach Rick Carlisle said the NBA did not speak with team doctors or players before issuing a $100K fine for violating the league's player participation policy, a claim the NBA has disputed.

title: When a 16-day strike by transport employees and a bus accident on Deepavali shook Tamil Nadu in 2001
content: In November 2001, transport corporation employeesâ€™ unions struck work demanding the Tamil Nadu government to increase annual bonus to 20%. During the strike, 28 persons were killed in Thoothukudi district in an accident involving a TNSTC bus allegedly driven by a temporary casual labourer.

content: The announcement of train service between Srinagar and Jammu was widely hailed as a historic move, even as direct train service between Kashmir andthe rest of the country still remains a dream.

content: US President Donald Trump called on the American Congress to pass the 'Delilah Law', which would bar illegal immigrants from receiving commercial driver's licences.

content: Amid the investigation into the Rs 590-crore fraud at the Chandigarh branch of IDFC FIRST Bank, the bank has said that it has repaid 100 per cent of the principal amount claimed by Haryana government departments.

content: India, according to Hassan-Nahoum, is not only a key trade partner for Israel but also a nation with shared values and a common vision centred on innovation, growth and resilience.

title: Elderly Tourist's Goa Tour Ends In Deadly Collision With Speeding Thar
content: A 65-year-old tourist from Bhopal died after a rented Mahindra Thar SUV collided with the rear of the family's hatchback at the Happy Bar junction in North Goa's Assagao. The incident occurred on Monday, police said.

title: Railway Board puts Vande Bharat Jammu-Srinagar extension on hold: Official
content: Earlier in the evening, Northern Railways had announced that the Vande Bharat Express would be extended up to Jammu Tawi from Katra, enabling direct connectivity between the twin capital cities of J&K from March 1

title: Amid DoT push, WhatsApp appears to test SIM-binding
content: DoT directions require the platform and other messaging apps to disable access if a SIM card is removed, and to log off users every six hours from companion access points like WhatsApp Web.

title: Vijayendra writes to Karnataka Chief Minister, seeking withdrawal of restrictions on media at Vidhana Soudha

title: Humane touch, not mere court orders, may help mitigate human-wildlife conflict: Supreme Court

title: Week 3 Top 25 and how to watch
content: Sophia Knight was named SEC Player of the Week after going 11-for-13 last week . she has recorded eight multi-hit games and is hitting .543 through the first 14 games of the season . here is the complete scoreboard here to stay up to date this spring .

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions
content: in 2024, a team USA squad full of stars, role players, up-and-comers and legends survived two thrillers . a 95-91 win over Nikola Jokic -led Serbia squad and an exhausting 98-87 clincher over host France . it doesn't appear that USA Basketball's graybearded Avengers will reassemble to chase a sixth consecutive gold .

title: Kings of the hot corner: Buster Olney ranks baseball's best third basemen
content: we rank the best of the best at third base . we will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the goal of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career.

title: Hooked on hockey after the Olympics? An updated look at the NHL's playoff picture
content: the NHL paused its season to allow its players to compete in the 2026 winter Olympics in Italy . around 143 players saw action in the Olympic men's hockey tournament . some return as bitter runners-ups, others as new minted gold medalists .

title: Trade grades: What can Brett Kulak do for the Avalanche?
content: the 2025-26 NHL trade season continues now that the Olympics and the Olympic roster freeze are over . the Vancouver Canucks traded defenseman Rasmus Andersson to the Vegas Golden Knights in exchange for a package that included defenseman Zach Whitecloud .

title: No one loves late drama like Liverpool. What's behind their taste for theatrics?
content: arsenal beat Nottingham Forest 1-0 in the premier league on sunday afternoon . the win is the latest dramatic installment in a campaign characterized by last-gasp winners . it is a quirk that has inflicted both joy and misery on head coach arne slot's side .
